Race.SpecificTitle: Town of Ferriday -- $1.28M -Bonds - Mayor & BOA - 15 Yrs.
Race.FullText: Shall the Town of Ferriday, State of Louisiana (the "Town"), incur debt and issue bonds to the amount of not exceeding One Million Two Hundred Eighty Thousand Dollars ($1,280,000), to run not exceeding fifteen (15) years from date thereof, with interest at a rate or rates not exceeding eight per centum (8%) per annum, for the purpose of constructing, paving and improving streets and roads in the Town, including attendant drainage, title to which shall be in the public; which bonds will be general obligations of the Town and will be payable from ad valorem taxes to be levied and collected in the manner provided by Article VI, Section 33 of the Constitution of the State of Louisiana of 1974 and statutory authority supplemental thereto, with an estimated 11.5 mills to be levied in the first year of issue to pay said Bonds?
